profile_positions.description:
Oversee implementation of the DFID-funded £120 million Health Pooled Fund. Reporting to the program director, the program manager role necessitates regular program management visits to South Sudan. Responsibilities include:

- Monitoring day-to-day activities undertaken by the in-country implementing team of 25 consultants.
- Consortium management; facilitating communication between implementing partners.
- Quality assurance of deliverables, including quarterly technical and financial reports to DFID.
- Support the team in managing procurement, program finances, security, and mobilization of technical assistance.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager - Health Pooled Fund South Sudan

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for managing Crown Agents’ Representative Office in Ethiopia. Responsibilities included:

- Supporting business winning, bid positioning, proposal development, contract negotiation and project delivery for all of Crown Agents’ business in Ethiopia.

-  Building and maintaining relationships with clients, international donors (DFID, World Bank, USAID, African Development Bank etc), potential consultancy partners, multilateral and international organizations and the Government of Ethiopia.

- Managing a team of 5 national staff, including mentoring of two newly hired staff members.

- Quarterly reporting to head office on business winning and project delivery activities.

- Overseeing and reporting on office budget and expenditure.

- Putting in place office policies and procedures (e.g. HR manual, Business Continuity Plan).
profile_positions.title: Client Liaison Representative, Crown Agents Ethiopia

profile_positions.description:
As a member of Crown Agents' Governance & Public Expenditure Management team I was responsible for contributing to business winning and project implementation. Duties included managing bid and proposal preparation, undertaking scoping visits to identify and scope out business opportunities, and providing inputs on ongoing Crown Agents projects in the areas of Public Financial Management and Governance.

Specific projects included:

Project Manager, Institutional Capacity Assessment of the Industries Department in Punjab, Pakistan

Managing a DFID-funded project to undertake an Institutional and Capacity assessment of the Industries department in Punjab. The key output will be a report recommending the scope of skills-related functions to be performed by the Industries Department, providing an in-depth analysis of important proposed functions such as policy stewardship and regulatory oversight, recommending collaboration modalities of the Industries Department with other skills related bodies and making recommendations on a way forward to enable the Department to perform skills-related functions in an efficient manner. 

Consultant, Public Financial Management and Accountability Project, Nepal

Responsible for ensuring continuity of project activities in the absence of the Team Leader and Deputy Team Leader. This included working with the Ministry of Health alongside the lead PFM consultant on revision of the Financial Management Improvement Plan. Also managed the succesful completion of other activities; the revision/creation of a Financial Management Report (FMR) in the Health and Forestry sectors, and a rapid financial risk study of funds intended for Karnali Employment Programme projects.
profile_positions.title: Consultant, Governance & Public Expenditure Management

profile_positions.description:
Worked in the Training department as Programme Coordinator. Responsibilities included preparing, writing and contributing to proposals for customised training courses, providing support to technical advisors in managing and administering scheduled training courses and conducting research to develop and improve the content, style and methodology of training. Other duties included managing training projects, managing bids, creating financial proposals and budgets for training courses and identifying & organising guest speakers and visits.

Project managed a project in collaboration with an organisation in South Sudan to support them in their aim to establish an Institute for Professional Development in Juba.

Project managed the department's largest project; the delivery 24 training courses for a single client in Nigeria. 

Business development aspects of the role included traveling in-country (Nigeria, Japan, China) to meet with clients, assess their (training) needs and follow up on proposals as well as conducting a market assessment to establish the feasibility of expanding the business into new geographies.
profile_positions.title: Programme Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
I was a Trainee at the Directorate for Communication, Press and Events and worked on the organisation of the Open Days, the largest annual event for Regions & Cities in Brussels. My responsibilities included facilitating communication with the Open Days partner regions & cities and drafting the event programme consisting of 111 debates and workshops. I also contributed to the creation of publications such as the Open Days Magazine. Other responsibilities included preparing and attending meetings with external event partners including other EU institutions, representative offices of European regions and also private companies. I was further responsible for maintaining the Committee of the Regions' online event calendar and involved in preparing documentation for several single-day events and workshops organised by the Committee of the Regions.

Co-organised and participated in a week-long study visit to Cyprus for 25 participants to learn about how the country is going about achieving the Europe 2020 environmental targets. I was involved in conducting research to determine which organisations to meet and helped arrange the programme of meetings for the week.
profile_positions.title: Trainee

profile_positions.description:
As a Policy Associate I assisted in lobbying members of the Washington DC City Council and members of the House of Representatives to gather support for two legal bills, proposed in both institutions, to make violence against homeless people a separately classed hate crime. 

Conducted research and contributed to the drafting of reports on Homeless Voting Rights, Criminalisation to Homelessness and Foreclosure to Homelessness. Other responsibilities included increasing the organisation's social media presence. 

Assisted NCH's Homeless Speaker's Bureau in its awareness raising activities in the greater Washington D.C. area. My duties comprised of accompanying the (formerly) homeless speakers to speaking engagements, monitoring the logistics of the event and moderating the presentations.

Completed my Bachelor's thesis comparing the state of homelessness in the Netherlands and the U.S.A.
profile_positions.title: Policy Intern
